Section.Heading: Very preliminary version of the manual

ManSection.Returns: The diagram of the geometry Gamma
ManSection.Description: Gamma must be a coset geometry.

ManSection.Returns: Does not return anything but wirtes a file filename.ps
ManSection.Description: Diag must be a diagram. Writes a file filename.ps in the current directory with a pictorial version of the diagram. This command uses the graphviz package which is available from http://www.graphviz.org.

ManSection.Returns: Returns the coset geometry defined by the list l of subgroups of the group G
ManSection.Description: G must be a group and l is a list of subgroups of G. The elements of the coset geometry are the cosets in G of the subgroups in l. Two elements are incident if and only if the corresponding cosets have nonempty intersection.

ManSection.Returns: true if ans only if ele1 and ele2 are incident
ManSection.Description: ele1 and ele2 must be two elements in thes same coset geometry.

ManSection.Returns: List of parabolic subgroups defining the coset geometry cg
the group of the coset geometry cg
ManSection.Description: cg must be a coset geometry.

ManSection.Returns: The Borel subgroup of de geometry cg
ManSection.Description: The Borel subgroup is equal to the stabilizer of a chamber. It corresponds to the untersection of all parabolic subgrops.

ManSection.Returns: true if and only if the group G defining cg acts flag-transitively.
ManSection.Description: cg must be a coset geometry.

ManSection.Returns: true if and only if cg is firm.
ManSection.Description: An incidence geometry is said to be firm if every nonmaximal flag is contained in at least two chambers. cg must be a coset geometry.

ManSection.Returns: true if and only if cg is connected.
ManSection.Description: A geometry is connected if and only if its incidence graph is connected. cg must be a coset geometry.

ManSection.Returns: true if and only if cg is residually connected.
ManSection.Description: A geometry is residually connected the incidence graphs of all its residues of rank at least 2 are connected. cg must be a coset geometry.

The standard chamber just consists of all parabolic subgroups (i.e. the trivial cosets of these subgroups). cg must be a coset geometry. Maybe this function should be called StandardChamberOfCosetGeometry.

ManSection.Returns: element of the defining group of cg which maps fl to the standard chamber of cg.
ManSection.Description: fl must be a chamber given as a list of cosets of the parabolic subgroups of cg. The order of the elements of the chamber should be the same as the order of the parabolics defining cg.

ManSection.Returns: coset geometry isomorphic to residue of fl in cg
ManSection.Description: cg must be a coset geometry and fl must be a flag in that geometry. The returned coset geometry for a flag {giGi} is ...

ManSection.Returns: The residue of fl in cg.

ManSection.Description: cg must be a coset geometry. The graph returned is a GRAPE object. Be sure the GRAPE is loaded!

cg must be a coset geometry of rank 2. This function computes the gonality, point and line diameter of cg. These appear as a list in the first entry of the returned list. The second entry contains a list of length 2 with the point order and the total number of points (i.e. elements of type 1) in the geometry. The last entry contains the line order and the number of lines.
